item.title: Evan add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "American writers ought to stand and live in the margins, and be more dangerous." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "The greater the scientific advance, the more primitive the fear." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "California deserves whatever it gets. Californians invented the concept of life-style. This alone warrants their doom." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "The power of the dead is that we think they see us all the time. The dead have a presence. Is there a level of energy composed solely of the dead? They are also in the ground, of course, asleep and crumbling. Perhaps we are what they dream." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "There are dead stars that still shine because their light is trapped in time. Where do I stand in this light, which does not strictly exist?" -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "Fear is unnatural. Lightning and thunder are unnatural. Pain, death, reality, these are all unnatural. We can't bear these things as they are. We know too much. So we resort to repression, compromise and disguise. This is how we survive the universe. This is the natural language of the species." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: Evan add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "maybe memories are like karaoke-where you realize up on the stage, with all those lyrics scrawling across the screen's bottom, and with everybody clapping at you, that you didn't know even half the lyrics to your all-time favourite song. Only afterwards, when someone else is up on stage humiliating themselves amid the clapping and laughing, do you realize that what you liiked most about your favourite song was precisely your ignorance of its full meaning- and you read more into it than maybe existed in the first place. I think it's better to not know the lyrics to your life." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Evan add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "You're right, a spleen is a strange thing-we technically don't need one, but maybe spleens are kept in our bodies in case we mutate or evolve, and if we grow wings or tentacles we need to have the spleen in place in order for them to work." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Evan add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "I realized that once people are broken in certain ways they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "You're bound to get idears if you go thinkin' about stuff" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I was born lost and take no pleasure in being found." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "For it is my opinion that we enclose and celebrate the freaks of our nation and our civilization. Yellowstone National Park is no more representative of America than is Disneyland." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I hate cameras. They are so much more sure than I am about everything." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It is one of the triumphs of the human that he can know a thing and still not believe it." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It has always seemed strange to me...The things we admire in men, kindness and generosity, openness, honesty, understanding and feeling, are the concomitants of failure in our system. And those traits we detest, sharpness, greed, acquisitiveness, meanness, egotism and self-interest, are the traits of success. And while men admire the quality of the first they love the produce of the second." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Evan add a quote by Martin Amis
item.description: "And meanwhile time goes about its immemorial work of making everyone look and feel like shit." -- Martin Amis

item.title: Evan add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Great books write themselves, only bad books have to be written." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Evan add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "For a transitory enchanted moment man must have held his breath in the presence of this continent, compelled into an aesthetic contemplation he neither understood nor desired, face to face for the last time in history with something commensurate to his capacity for wonder." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Evan add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I couldn’t forgive him or like him, but I saw that what he had done was, to him, entirely justified. It was all very careless and confused. They were careless people, Tom and Daisy—they smashed up things and creatures and then retreated back into their money or their vast carelessness, or whatever it was that kept them together, and let other people clean up the mess they had made." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Evan add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "We live as we dream--alone...." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Evan add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "His very existence was improbable, inexplicable, and altogether bewildering. He was an insoluble problem. It was inconceivable how he had existed, how he had succeeded in getting so far, how he had managed to remain -- why he did not instantly disappear." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Evan add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "You shall judge of a man by his foes as well as by his friends." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Evan add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"the writing of some men is like a vast bridge that carries you over the many things that claw and tear.
The Wine of Forever" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Evan add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Evan add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Show me a man who lives alone and has a perpetually clean kitchen, and 8 times out of 9 I'll show you a man with detestable spiritual qualities." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Evan add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Sometimes you just have to pee in the sink." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Evan add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "But in a story, which is a kind of dreaming, the dead sometimes smile and sit up and return to the world." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Evan add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "It was my view then, and still is, that you don't make war without knowing why. Knowledge of course, is always imperfect, but it seemed to me that when a nation goes to war it must have reasonable confidence in the justice and imperative of its cause. You can't fix your mistakes. Once people are dead, you can't make them undead." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Evan add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?" -- Virginia Woolf
